summary: This document is a series of emails from August 13-15, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff and Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) legal staff, arranging a visit to the MCC to inspect Jeffrey Epstein's cell and other areas following his death. The emails discuss logistics, visitor lists, and security protocols.

keyFacts: SDNY officials, including US Attorney Geoffrey Berman, planned a visit to the MCC on or after August 15, 2019, following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The specific purpose was to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation/suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein's cell, which was noted as still being cordoned off.
The visiting party requested that only MCC legal staff escort them and that they would not speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
Additional DOJ officials, including Principal Deputy Attorney General Ed O'Callahan, were added to the visitor list.
The correspondence shows coordination between federal prosecutors and prison legal staff regarding post-mortem investigative access to the facility.
